Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information furnished to and provided by agencies that make child care referrals.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Information furnished to and provided by agencies that make child care referrals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the public dissemination of information regarding regulated child day care services.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the public dissemination of information regarding child care facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring regular reports regarding child day care facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring regular reports regarding child care facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities following inspections where violations are identified.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Office of Children and Family Services and the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to negotiate a contract for the inspection of child care facilities regulated under state law that facilitates the development of a unified database to provide parents in New York City access to crucial information regarding child care providers.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to information furnished to and provided by agencies that make child care referrals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities.

Items.MatterName: Creating disclosure requirements for child care facilities following inspections where violations are identified.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the New York State Office of Children and Family Services and the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to negotiate a contract for the inspection of child care facilities regulated under state law that facilitates the development of a unified database to provide parents in New York City access to crucial information regarding child care providers.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
